poem:
"Interlude in Scottish Politics"

Beneath a roof of political rhetoric, 
John Swinney makes a stand,
In the austere ballet of power, he thrusts forward,
While the whispering winds of Wednesday recede.
Life, like a pickpocket, switches leaders unnoticed,
And Humza steps off the stage, leaving footprints in history. 
One hand on the scepter, the other on unity,
A dance begins between decision and destiny.
